intro: Dasyglossum contaypacchaense, commonly known as the Contaypaccha beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive, downward-facing flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
